page.title: 10HELSTON YOUTH CLUB
page.content: From 1965 to 1970, there was a youth club in the basement of the Vicarage in Cross Street. In 1970, a purpose built youth club, costing Â£25,000 was built, known as {"Centrepoint."} The club provides social and physical recreation for juniors from 9-14 and seniors 14-21 in their leisure time. Activities include gymnastics, judo, B.M.X., table tennis, break-dancing and disco dancing. There are play groups and keep fit classes. At present the club has 638 members. It is self supporting, apart from a small grant from County Education. It is run by one full time professional youth leader, one paid part time leader and 36 voluntary workers.
